title: Paper Co-written by Lawrence Summers Says Hot Jobs Market Fueling Inflation
body: The extremely tight labor market is a major source of inflation in the U.S., Lawrence Summers, a former Treasury secretary and one-time potential candidate for Federal Reserve chair, says in a paper co-written with Alex Domash. In the paper made public on Monday by the National Bureau of Economic Research, the Harvard University academics say that job vacancy and quit rates in the U.S. “correspond to a degree of labor market tightness previously associated with sub-2% unemployment rates.” They also say that their findings “along with a cursory analysis of labor force participation information, suggest that labor market...
